name: xpcoidgend
params: class c0, class c1, wff w0
body: |- wi(w0, wceq(ccom(cxp(c0, c1), cxp(c0, c1)), cxp(c0, c1)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(ccom(cxp(c0, c1), cxp(c0, c1)), cxp(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wne(cin(c1, c0), emptycls))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(ccom(cxp(c0, c1), cxp(c0, c1)), cxp(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wne(cin(c1, c0), emptycls))

stmt.origin: syl5eqner(cin(c1, c0), emptycls, cin(c0, c1), w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wne(cin(c1, c0), emptycls))
-| wceq(cin(c0, c1), cin(c1, c0))
-| wi(w0, wne(cin(c0, c1), emptycls))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(ccom(cxp(c0, c1), cxp(c0, c1)), cxp(c0, c1)))
-| wceq(cin(c0, c1), cin(c1, c0))
-| wi(w0, wne(cin(c0, c1), emptycls))

|- wi(w0, wceq(ccom(cxp(c0, c1), cxp(c0, c1)), cxp(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wne(cin(c0, c1), emptycls))

comment: If two classes are not disjoint, then the composition of their cross-product with itself is idempotent. (Contributed by RP, 24-Dec-2019.)
